intro: Argyrella angolensis, commonly known as the Angola silverleaf, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its silver-green foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are often visited by insects, contributing to its role in local ecosystems. Argyrella angolensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in herbal medicine.
